help.blockchain.consent.list: Manage and find all evidence of consent issued to holders of personal data. Information can take 60 to 90 seconds to be updated according to the volume of transactions on the blockchain.

help.blockchain.consent.new.step1: Enter the email address of the recipient who will receive the consent request. You will not be able to retrieve that email later, it will be anonymized after sending.
help.blockchain.consent.new.step2: Here you must write the conditions of consent, that is, what the recipient has agreed to and will confirm. This content will be saved in a pseudo-anonymous way in order to offer verification of integrity.
help.blockchain.consent.new.step3: Enter an internal identifier that will help you trace this consent. The email above will be anonymized but the identifier will not.
help.blockchain.immunity.new.step1: The first step is to inform the email of the recipient who will receive the passport.
help.blockchain.immunity.new.step3: The second step is to create a passport identifier that you will always know. Remember, the email above will be anonymized for you so use an identifier that supports you.
help.blockchain.immunity.new.step4: Enter additional passport information to supplement the above information (this information will be sent to the user).
help.blockchain.immunity.new.step5: Answer the test below to generate the passport for that user
help.blockchain.timestamp.edit: In the field below place the content you want to apply the time stamp to.
help.blockchain.timestamp.list: Manage and find the registered time stamps. Here are the individual stamps and also the stamps generated by the consent tests. The tests that are like " Wait for registration " have already been validated but await validation on the public Blockchain which takes a few hours.
help.blockchain.timestamp.merkle: How does it work? The first 'File sha256 hash' matches the hash of your registered content. This hash is not sent directly to the blockchain. A hash from another transaction (another customer or another transaction yours) goes through the same process and both generate a new hash. This process occurs several times for several transactions until it generates the merkle root (merkle root) that is sent to the Blockchain. In the log below you get proof that the block in the blockchain hashed a value generated by all previous transactions, including yours.

label.legalbasis.1: Consent - Upon the consent of the holder
label.legalbasis.11: Consent - Consent must be specific, granular, clear, prominent, opt-in, documented and easily withdrawn
label.legalbasis.12: Contract - Necessary for the purpose of a contract
label.legalbasis.14: Vital interests - Vital interests are intended to cover only interests that are essential for someone’s life
label.legalbasis.15: Public interest - This basis applies where the processing of personal data is required for the performance of a task or function that is carried out in the public interest or as part of the exercise of official authority vested in the data controller
label.legalbasis.16: Legitimate interests - It includes individual interests, commercial interests and other broader societal interests
label.legalbasis.17: Sensitive data - To guarantee fraud prevention and the security of the holder
label.legalbasis.2: Regulatory - To comply with legal or regulatory obligations by the controller
label.legalbasis.3: Government - For public administration, for processing data necessary for public policies
label.legalbasis.4: Research - To carry out studies by a research body, ensuring data anonymization
label.legalbasis.5: Contracts - When necessary for contract execution
label.legalbasis.6: Judicial - Regular exercise of rights, including in contract and in judicial, administrative and arbitration proceedings
label.legalbasis.7: Life - For the protection of life or physical safety of the holder or third parties
label.legalbasis.8: Health - For the protection of health, with a procedure carried out by health professionals or by health entities
label.legalbasis.9: Legitimate interest - Legitimate interests of the controller or third party

portal.html.start:
Your privacy is important


We are committed to safeguarding your privacy and protecting your Personal Data and we want to explain to you a little more about how we treat your Personal Data.

But why do we treat your Personal Data?


We are committed to always offering the best products, experiences and consumption journey, believing in your power of When it comes to protecting Personal Data, this involves a commitment to the security of your Data and respect for your privacy, but also our commitment to you being in control of your Personal Data.
portal.html.start.new.en:
What is LGPD?

The General Data Protection Law (LGPD) was enacted in August 2018 and came into force in August 2020. The LGPD establishes rules on any activity that can be carried out with personal data, from collection, storage, sharing and disposal, seeking more protection for citizens and sanctions for companies for non-compliance.

Main objectives

  • Privacy protection

    Ensure the right to privacy and the right to the protection of personal data, through transparent and secure practices, guaranteeing all fundamental rights.

  • Standardization and norms

    Propose harmonious rules on the processing of personal data, applicable to all agents who collect and process personal data.

  • Transparency

    Enable clear and easily accessible rules regarding the processing of personal data.

  • Legal certainty

    Enable the strengthening of security in legal relations, the confidence of the holder of personal data, guaranteeing free initiative, free competition and the defense of commercial and consumer relations.

  • Development

    Enable both technological and economic development.

  • Favoring competition

    Promote competition and free enterprise in economic activity.

 

What is personal data?

The General Data Protection Law (LGPD) was enacted in August 2018 and will enter into force in August 2020. The LGPD establishes rules on any activity that can be carried out with personal data, from collection, storage, sharing and disposal ( activities known as "treatment "), aiming at more protection for citizens and sanctions for companies for non-compliance.

 

And sensitive personal data?

The LGPD also brings the concept of sensitive personal data, which is information that, because it allows discrimination, should be treated with even more care, such as, for example, information of racial or ethnic origin, religious belief, political opinion and health-related data. Today, many business models use personal data.

Manage your consents

To manage your consents and requests you must first authenticate yourself on the platform.

The committed to your data

The data and activity records collected will be stored in a safe and controlled environment. Your data is accessed only by duly authorized professionals, respecting the principles of proportionality, necessity and relevance to our objectives, in addition to the commitment to confidentiality and preservation of privacy under the terms of this policy.
portal.html.start.new.es:
¿Qué es LGPD?

La Ley General de Protección de Datos (LGPD) fue promulgada en agosto de 2018 y entró en vigor en agosto de 2020. La LGPD establece normas sobre cualquier actividad que se pueda realizar con datos personales, desde la recolección, almacenamiento, intercambio y disposición, buscando mayor protección para ciudadanos y sanciones a las empresas por incumplimiento.

Objetivos principales

  • Protección de la privacidad

    Asegurar el derecho a la privacidad y el derecho a la protección de los datos personales, mediante prácticas transparentes y seguras, garantizando todos los derechos fundamentales.

  • Estandarización y normas

    Proponer reglas armoniosas sobre el procesamiento de datos personales, aplicables a todos los agentes que recopilan y procesan datos personales

  • Transparencia

    Habilite reglas claras y de fácil acceso sobre el procesamiento de datos personales.

  • Seguridad jurídica

    Permitir el fortalecimiento de la seguridad en las relaciones jurídicas, la confianza del titular de los datos personales, garantizando la libre iniciativa, la libre competencia y la defensa de las relaciones comerciales y de consumo.

  • Desarrollo

    Permitir el desarrollo tanto tecnológico como económico.

  • Favoreciendo la competencia

    Promover la competencia y la libre empresa en la actividad económica.

 

¿Qué son los datos personales?

La Ley General de Protección de Datos (LGPD) fue promulgada en agosto de 2018 y entrará en vigor en agosto de 2020. La LGPD establece normas sobre cualquier actividad que se pueda realizar con datos personales, desde la recolección, almacenamiento, intercambio y disposición (actividades conocidas como "trato"), con el objetivo de una mayor protección para los ciudadanos y sanciones para las empresas en caso de incumplimiento.

 

¿Y datos personales sensibles?

La LGPD también trae el concepto de datos personales sensibles, que es información que, por permitir la discriminación, debe ser tratada con aún más cuidado, como por ejemplo, información de origen racial o étnico, creencias religiosas, opinión política y salud. En la actualidad, muchos modelos comerciales incluidas utilizan datos personales.

Gestiona tus consentimientos

Para gestionar sus consentimientos y solicitudes, primero debe autenticarse en la plataforma.

Somos comprometido con sus datos

The data and activity records collected will be stored in a safe and controlled environment. Your data is accessed only by duly authorized professionals, respecting the principles of proportionality, necessity and relevance to our objectives, in addition to the commitment to confidentiality and preservation of privacy under the terms of this policy.
portal.html.start.new.pt:
O que é LGPD?

A Lei Geral de Proteção de Dados (LGPD) foi sancionada em agosto de 2018 e entrou em vigor em agosto de 2020. A LGPD estabelece regras sobre qualquer atividade que pode ser realizada com dados pessoais, desde a coleta, armazenamento, compartilhamento e descarte, visando mais proteção para os cidadãos e sanções para as empresas pelo não cumprimento.

Objetivos principais

  • Proteção à privacidade

    Assegurar o direito à privacidade e o direito à proteção de dados pessoais, por meio de práticas transparentes e seguras, garantindo todos os direitos fundamentais.

  • Padronização e normas

    Propor regras harmônicas sobre o tratamento de dados pessoais, aplicáveis a todos os agentes os quais coletam e tratam dados pessoais.

  • Transparência

    Viabilizar regras claras e de fácil acesso acerca do tratamento de dados pessoais.

  • Segurança jurídica

    Viabilizar o fortalecimento de segurança nas relações jurídicas, a confiança do titular dos dados pessoais, garantindo a livre iniciativa, a livre concorrência e a defesa das relações comerciais e de consumo.

  • Desenvolvimento

    Viabilizar o desenvolvimento tanto tecnológico quanto econômico.

  • Favorecimento à concorrência

    Promover a concorrência e a livre iniciativa à atividade econômica.

 

O que são dados pessoais?

A Lei Geral de Proteção de Dados (LGPD) foi sancionada em agosto de 2018 e entrará em vigor em agosto de 2020. A LGPD estabelece regras sobre qualquer atividade que pode ser realizada com dados pessoais, desde a coleta, armazenamento, compartilhamento e descarte (atividades conhecidas como "tratamento"), visando mais proteção para os cidadãos e sanções para as empresas pelo não cumprimento.

 

E dados pessoais sensíveis?

A LGPD traz ainda o conceito de dados pessoais sensíveis, que são informações que, por permitirem discriminação, devem ser tratados com ainda mais cuidado, como por exemplo, informações de origem racial ou étnica, convicção religiosa, opinião política e dados referentes à saúde.Hoje muitos modelos de negócio utilizado dados pessoais.

Gerencie seus consentimentos

Para gerenciar seus consentimentos e solicitações você precisa primeiro se autenticar na plataforma.

O compromisso com os teus dados

Os dados e os registros de atividades coletados serão armazenados em ambiente seguro e controlado. Os seus dados são acessados somente por profissionais devidamente autorizados, respeitados os princípios de proporcionalidade, necessidade e relevância para os nossos objetivos, além do compromisso de confidencialidade e preservação da privacidade nos termos desta política.
